chapter.title: Working with Print Jobs
chapter.para: The following sections describe how you can create custom print jobs (configuration objects for print output) for one or more documents in addition to the preconfigured print jobs for the provided standard processes. The following actions are supported for the Print Jobs view:

sect1.title: Creating a Print Job
sect1.para: You can create a new print job. You can configure the desired properties in a separate dialog.
Proceed as follows to create a new print job.

step.para: Switch to the Print Jobs view.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Create
(Create).

result.para: The Create Print Jobs dialog opens.

step.para: Enter a unique identifier for the new print job in the ID field.
In the Query field, Indicate the SQL query the print job is to use for creating the print data.
In the Application field, specify which application should be used to create the print job.
In the Reprint Application field, specify which application should be used for reprinting.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the new print job and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the new print job is displayed in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the print job and exit the editing mode without saving the print job.

sect1.title: Listing Print Jobs
sect1.para: You can display an overview of the configured print jobs in the workspace of the Print Jobs view.
The overview table displays the following information for each configured print job by default:

listitem.para: Name of the print job, which can be used to reference this print job
SQL query used by the print job for creating the print data.
Application that should be used to create the print job.
Application that should be used for reprinting.

sect1.title: Displaying Print Job Details
sect1.para: You can display the details for a specific print job in the details pane. Compared to the overview table, the print job contains an additional information element.

mediaobject.alt: Print Jobs view with details pane

sect1.para: The following information is currently available in the details pane.

listitem.para: Name of the print job, which can be used to reference this print job
Process, to which the print job is connected.
SQL query used by the print job for creating the print data.
Application that should be used to create the print job.
Application that should be used for reprinting.

sect1.title: Modifying a Print Job
sect1.para: You can edit the print job properties.

note.para: Please keep in mind that you cannot use this action to modify the print job ID. You can modify the query, application and reprint application. To modify the print job ID, create a new print job with the desired name (see ).

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the values of an existing print job:

step.para: Switch to the Print Jobs view.
Double-click the desired row in the overview table.

result.para: The entry switches to editing mode.

step.para: In the Query field, specify the desired new SQL query that the print job should use to create the print data.
In the Application field, specify which application should be used to create the print job.
In the Reprint Application field, specify the desired new application through which the reprint is to be created.

Click Save button
(Save) to save the print job with the updated values and exit the editing mode.

result.para: The editing mode is terminated and the print job is displayed with the updated values in the overview table.

step.para:
Click Cancel button
(Cancel) to cancel the creation of the print job and exit the editing mode without saving the print job.

sect1.title: Modifying Multiple Print Jobs
sect1.para: You can edit selected values for multiple print jobs in one step.

note.para: Please keep in mind that with this function, you define the same values for all selected print jobs.

sect1.para: Proceed as follows to edit the properties of the selected print jobs.

step.para: Switch to the Print Jobs view.
Select at least two print jobs from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the web interface, click Icon Edit
(Edit).
Tick the checkbox in front of each value you want to change for all selected print jobs.
In the Process field, specify the process to which all selected print jobs should be linked.
In the Query field, specify the desired SQL query that the selected print jobs should use to create the print data.
In the Application field, specify which application should be used to create print jobs.
In the Reprint Application field, specify which application should be used for reprinting the selected print jobs.
Click OK to save the changed settings for all selected print jobs and close the dialog.

result.para: The changed settings for the selected print jobs are displayed in the overview table and in the details pane.

step.para: Click Cancel to close the dialog without changing the settings.

sect1.title: Deleting Print Jobs
sect1.para: Use this action to delete a single print job or multiple print jobs. Proceed as follows to delete existing print jobs.

step.para: Switch to the Print Jobs view.
Select at least one print job from the overview table.

In the navigation bar of the view, click Button Delete
(Delete).

result.para: The confirmation dialog Delete Print Jobs opens.

step.para: In the confirmation dialog Delete Print Jobs, click OK to delete the selected print job (or print jobs).
In the confirmation dialog Delete Print Jobs, click Cancel to close the dialog without deleting the selected print job(s).

result.para: If the print jobs have been successfully deleted, a success message is displayed in a separate dialog.
If the print job could not be deleted, a corresponding error message is displayed.
